column4: Is it just me and my messed up system or why does this happen: apt-get upgrade: e2fslibs: Depends: libc6 (>= 2.3.2.ds1-21) but 2.3.2.ds1-20ubuntu13 is installed \n e2fsprogs: PreDepends: e2fslibs (= 1.35-8ubuntu2) but 1.37+1.38-WIP-0509-1 is installed ?
are you using non-ubuntu repos?
universe :)
and marillat
the marillat is causing the problem
right. I'll look in to it
commenting out those marillat repos doesn't work. Any ideas on how to fix this?
remove the offending item (use synaptic)
then reinstall from ubuntu repos
The package which I get complaints when trying to upgrade, e2fslibs, can't removed due to dependencies.
to solve your problem, you will have to dismantle the house marillat made for you
a piece at a time

they made a big house of doom for me. I see couple of options, 1) blow the whole house and rebuild it 2) wait for next ubuntu release to upgrade packages or 3) get packages from debian unstable, try to work it out and then revert to option number 1. No other options?
and it can't be done. Packages such as sysvinit and ubuntu-base depend on e2fslibs indirectly.
sounds like you have it well in hand
this is why backports and marillat are not advised

I understand that backports suck and was amazed to see it as a official project of ubuntu. It seems to be very much in conflict with ubuntu idea and doesn't do any good. I used marillat due to decoders and such, it worked with debian (if I remember correctly) so I saw no problem using it.
in the future, enable the "off" repos, get what you need and disable them
I'll do that. Thanks for your tips
another way is to build from source (using apt-get)
right. Gotta get some sleep, it's been a long day. Good night
